other_tests.findings: Basal and ACTH-stimulated D5-17P levels were unequivocally elevated; normal basal 17-OHP level rose moderately in response to ACTH stimulation for the patient with nonsalt-wasting 3bHSD deficiency.
other_tests.changes_over_time: At age 2 yr, both hydrocortisone and Florinef acetate were discontinued for 6 weeks and the patient remained asymptomatic, with no clinical or biochemical evidence of adrenal insufficiency.

other_tests.findings: At 7 days, the infant had normal serum electrolytes; however, serum DHEA levels were inappropriately elevated at 3 weeks, correlating with symptoms of lethargy and shock.
other_tests.changes_over_time: At age 2 yr, serum DHEA and PRA levels were elevated compared to the reported age-matched normal values after a 2-day discontinuation of maintenance hydrocortisone and Florinef; at age 17 yr, random hormonal levels were reevaluated and found exceedingly high.
